content:
TITLE: Uploading Objects to Aliyun OSS in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to upload a file (object) to Aliyun OSS using the putObject method. Requires bucket name, object name, and the content to be uploaded.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/alioss/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php
$bucket = "<您使用的Bucket名字，注意命名规范>";
$object = "<您使用的Object名字，注意命名规范>";
$content = "Hello, OSS!"; // 上传的文件内容
try {
    $ossClient->putObject($bucket, $object, $content);
} catch (OssException $e) {
    print $e->getMessage();
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing OssClient in Aliyun OSS SDK for PHP
DESCRIPTION: Creates an OssClient object with access credentials and endpoint information to enable interaction with Aliyun OSS services. Requires AccessKeyId, AccessKeySecret, and endpoint parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/alioss/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php
$accessKeyId = "<您从OSS获得的AccessKeyId>"; ;
$accessKeySecret = "<您从OSS获得的AccessKeySecret>";
$endpoint = "<您选定的OSS数据中心访问域名，例如oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com>";
try {
    $ossClient = new OssClient($accessKeyId, $accessKeySecret, $endpoint);
} catch (OssException $e) {
    print $e->getMessage();
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting Files by Regular Expression in PHP using PclZip
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the extract() method with PCLZIP_OPT_BY_EREG or PCLZIP_OPT_BY_PREG options to extract files from a zip archive based on a regular expression pattern.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
extract($archive, PCLZIP_OPT_BY_EREG, $regular_expression)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting Files by Name in PHP using PclZip
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the extract() method with PCLZIP_OPT_BY_NAME option to extract specific files or folders from a zip archive by providing their names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
extract($archive, PCLZIP_OPT_BY_NAME, $filename_or_array)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Storage Buckets in Aliyun OSS with PHP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a new storage bucket (container for objects) in Aliyun OSS. A bucket is required before uploading any objects to OSS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/alioss/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php
$bucket = "<您使用的Bucket名字，注意命名规范>";
try {
    $ossClient->createBucket($bucket);
} catch (OssException $e) {
    print $e->getMessage();
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting File as String in PHP using PclZip
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to extract a file directly into a string variable without using temporary files, using the PCLZIP_OPT_EXTRACT_AS_STRING option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
extract($archive, PCLZIP_OPT_EXTRACT_AS_STRING)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling List Results from Aliyun OSS in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to process returned data from list operations in Aliyun OSS. This example shows how to list all available buckets and display their location, name, and creation date.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/alioss/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php
$bucketListInfo = $ossClient->listBuckets();
$bucketList = $bucketListInfo->getBucketList();
foreach($bucketList as $bucket) {
    print($bucket->getLocation() . "\t" . $bucket->getName() . "\t" . $bucket->getCreatedate() . "\n");
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Callback Functions with PclZip in PHP
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use callback functions for pre and post-extraction or addition operations using options like PCLZIP_CB_PRE_EXTRACT and PCLZIP_CB_POST_ADD.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
extract($archive, PCLZIP_CB_PRE_EXTRACT, 'myPreExtractCallback')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Uncompressed Files to Archive in PHP using PclZip
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add files to a zip archive without compression using the PCLZIP_OPT_NO_COMPRESSION option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
add($archive, $files, PCLZIP_OPT_NO_COMPRESSION)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting File Permissions After Extraction in PHP using PclZip
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to change the mode (permissions) of a file after extraction using the PCLZIP_OPT_SET_CHMOD option with extract() or extractByIndex() methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/readme.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
extract($archive, PCLZIP_OPT_SET_CHMOD, $chmod_value)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating WebUploader Directory Structure
DESCRIPTION: A complete directory listing showing all available WebUploader implementation files including complete versions, minified versions, Flash-only implementations, HTML5-only implementations, and custom builds for mobile usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/web/resource/components/webuploader/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
├── Uploader.swf                      # SWF文件，当使用Flash运行时需要引入。
├
├── webuploader.js                    # 完全版本。
├── webuploader.min.js                # min版本
├
├── webuploader.flashonly.js          # 只有Flash实现的版本。
├── webuploader.flashonly.min.js      # min版本
├
├── webuploader.html5only.js          # 只有Html5实现的版本。
├── webuploader.html5only.min.js      # min版本
├
├── webuploader.noimage.js            # 去除图片处理的版本，包括HTML5和FLASH.
├── webuploader.noimage.min.js        # min版本
├
├── webuploader.custom.js             # 自定义打包方案，请查看 Gruntfile.js，满足移动端使用。
└── webuploader.custom.min.js         # min版本
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Mini-Program Folder Naming Convention
DESCRIPTION: Shows the required naming format for mini-program frontend folders where the folder name should match the application identifier followed by '_wxapp'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```应用标识_wxapp```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installation URL Path
DESCRIPTION: The URL path to access the installation page for the community version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```https://域名/install.php ```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cache Clearing URL Path
DESCRIPTION: The URL path for clearing the system cache when upgrading an existing installation to the community version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```https://域名/clear-cache.php```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing Application Manifest File Path
DESCRIPTION: A Markdown link to the manifest.xml documentation, which is required for application recognition in the system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
[manifest.xml](https://wiki.w7.com/document/35/1525)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing WeChat Developer Tools
DESCRIPTION: A Markdown link to the WeChat Developer Tools, which users need for uploading mini-programs to the WeChat platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
[微信开发者工具](https://developers.weixin.qq.com/miniprogram/dev/devtools/stable.html)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: LGPL License Application Template
DESCRIPTION: A template for applying the GNU Lesser General Public License to new libraries. The template includes placeholders for the library name, copyright year, and author information, along with standard license text concerning redistribution rights and warranty disclaimers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/gnu-lgpl.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
<one line to give the library's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
Lesser General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public
License along with this library; if not, write to the Free Software
Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copyright Disclaimer Template for LGPL
DESCRIPTION: A sample copyright disclaimer template for employers of programmers or educational institutions to disclaim copyright interest in a library. This template is recommended as part of properly applying the LGPL to new software libraries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/testing365/w7/blob/main/framework/library/phpexcel/PHPExcel/Shared/PCLZip/gnu-lgpl.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the
library `Frob' (a library for tweaking knobs) written by James Random Hacker.

<signature of Ty Coon>, 1 April 1990
Ty Coon, President of Vice
```
